Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number 15 is written in pencil on the sherd's exterior surface. According to Cook and Woodhead, the writer of the inscription on this sherd is the same as on British Museum 1924,1201.791. Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis (Williams 1983, 169). Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 167, no. 67, pl. 35, no.18)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 720, no. 789)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1811) (phase 2)
